title: Speech-to-Text Real-Time Transcription Accuracy
description: Verify that the Speech-to-Text feature transcribes spoken words into text in real-time with at least 85% accuracy under normal conditions.

steps.description: Launch the Accessibility Companion web app and navigate to the Speech-to-Text feature.
Enable microphone access when prompted.
Speak a predetermined clear sentence aloud.
Check that the transcription appears in the live transcript panel in real-time.
Verify the transcription accuracy is at or above 85% compared to the spoken sentence.
Test with different speech volumes and accents.
Ensure transcription accuracy remains consistent across variations.

title: Speech-to-Text Microphone Access Denial Handling
description: Ensure the application handles cases where microphone access is denied gracefully and offers fallback or informative messages.

steps.description: Launch the Accessibility Companion web app and navigate to the Speech-to-Text feature.
Deny microphone access when prompted by the browser.
Verify an informative error message is displayed stating microphone access is required.
Verify the app offers fallback mode or demo data option to maintain usability.

title: Text-to-Speech Basic Playback with Voice Selection and Speed Control
description: Validate that the Text-to-Speech feature reads selected text aloud using the selected voice and speed settings with correct text highlighting during playback.

steps.description: Select a text block on a webpage.
Open the Accessibility Companion toolbar and activate the Text-to-Speech feature.
Select a voice option different from the default.
Adjust the speech playback speed.
Start playback.
Verify the selected text is read aloud with the chosen voice and speed.
Ensure the text is highlighted progressively during playback corresponding to the words being read.

title: Text-to-Speech Handles Empty or Non-Selectable Text
description: Ensure the Text-to-Speech feature handles cases where the user tries to read empty or non-selectable text gracefully.

steps.description: Activate the Text-to-Speech feature without selecting any text.
Verify that an informative message prompts the user to select text.
Try selecting an image or non-text element and invoke Text-to-Speech.
Confirm that the feature does not crash and informs the user appropriately.

title: Hand Gesture Recognition for Five Common Gestures
description: Validate that the Hand Gesture Recognition detects and classifies five predefined gestures with at least 80% confidence and triggers mapped web actions reliably.

steps.description: Launch the Accessibility Companion and navigate to the Hand Gesture Recognition feature.
Grant camera access when prompted.
Perform each of the five predefined hand gestures in front of the camera.
Confirm that each gesture is correctly detected and classified with confidence above 80%.
Verify the appropriate mapped web action (e.g., click, scroll, pause, play) is triggered on the interface for each gesture.
Ensure on-screen visual feedback displays the detected gesture and action executed.

title: Hand Gesture Recognition Camera Access Denial Handling
description: Verify that if camera access is denied, the Hand Gesture Recognition feature handles the situation with an informative message and fallback options.

steps.description: Navigate to Hand Gesture Recognition feature.
Deny camera access when prompted.
Verify an informative error message is displayed stating camera access is required.
Verify fallback or demo mode is available to maintain usability.

title: Voice Command Parser Recognizes and Executes Commands
description: Test that the Voice Command Parser correctly recognizes predefined voice commands such as 'click', 'scroll down', 'scroll up', and 'read this' and triggers expected interface actions.

steps.description: Activate the voice command feature in the Accessibility Companion.
Speak the command 'click' while focusing on a clickable element.
Verify the element is clicked or activated.
Speak the commands 'scroll down' and 'scroll up'.
Confirm the page scrolls in the corresponding direction.
Use the command 'read this' with text selected.
Check that the Text-to-Speech feature is triggered and reads the selected text.

title: Voice Command Parser Handles Unknown or Ambiguous Commands
description: Ensure that the Voice Command Parser gracefully handles unrecognized commands and provides appropriate feedback.

steps.description: Enable the voice command feature.
Speak a command that is not part of the predefined set.
Verify the system responds with a message indicating the command is not recognized.

title: Text Formatting Options Apply Correctly
description: Verify that users can customize text formatting including dyslexia-friendly fonts, adjustable font size, line height, letter spacing, and high contrast themes and that changes reflect immediately.

steps.description: Open the Accessibility Toolbar and navigate to Text Formatting settings.
Select a dyslexia-friendly font option.
Confirm the font on the webpage updates immediately to the selected font.
Adjust font size to maximum and minimum allowed values.
Verify the font size on the webpage changes correspondingly.
Modify line and letter spacing settings.
Check that these spacing changes apply immediately and improve readability.
Select different high contrast color themes.
Ensure the webpage color theme updates instantly and passes WCAG contrast guidelines.

title: Text Formatting Persistence During Session and Settings Save
description: Ensure that text formatting settings persist during the user session and can be saved and restored correctly.

steps.description: Apply text formatting settings via the Accessibility Toolbar.
Navigate to a different page or refresh the browser.
Verify that applied text formatting settings persist during the session.
Use the save settings feature to store current preferences.
Restart the web app and load saved settings.
Confirm that previously saved text formatting preferences are restored correctly.

title: Accessibility Toolbar UI Responsiveness and Accessibility
description: Verify that the Accessibility Toolbar is fully responsive, keyboard navigable, and screen reader friendly across desktop and mobile browsers.

steps.description: Open the Accessibility Companion on desktop browser.
Verify that toolbar UI elements adjust layout gracefully when resizing the browser window.
Navigate all toolbar elements using only keyboard navigation (tab, arrow keys, enter).
Confirm every interactive element is reachable and actionable via keyboard.
Use a screen reader to navigate the toolbar.
Verify all UI controls have correct ARIA labels and roles announced properly to assistive technology.
Repeat UI responsiveness and accessibility tests on a mobile browser.

title: API Response Time Under Normal Load
description: Ensure backend API endpoints for gesture detection and command execution respond within 200ms under normal load conditions.

steps.description: Trigger gesture detection API by performing a hand gesture.
Capture and verify that the API response time is below 200 milliseconds.
Trigger command execution API by issuing a voice command.
Confirm the response time complies with the 200 milliseconds threshold.

title: Error Handling During API Failure with Fallback Mode
description: Verify that in case of backend API failures or outages, the Accessibility Companion maintains usability by switching to fallback or demo modes.

steps.description: Simulate backend API failure for gesture detection and command execution.
Attempt to use gesture recognition and voice command features.
Verify that the system does not crash and provides fallback or demo mode functionality.
Check that users are informed about degraded mode operation appropriately.
